headline: ‘Field of Broken Dreams’: London Taxis’ Growing Graveyards
text: EPPING, England — Drive through a leaf-strewn forest and past a charming street market in this town about 20 miles northeast of London, and a jarring sight appears: black London taxis, parked bumper-to-bumper by the hundreds in a muddy field, surrounded by beehives and a barn for raising squab pigeons.
snippet: Confronted with deserted streets during the pandemic, drivers are turning in their rented black cabs by the hundreds.
